dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Seventy years for the Baikonur Cosmodrome—that's just incredible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seventy years for the Baikonur Cosmodrome-that's just incredible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kassym-Jomart Tokayev delivered a video message on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the Baikonur Cosmodrome, according to a statement from Akorda.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And President Tokayev's gave this video address honoring the workers and veterans there. He called it the cradle of global astronautics, which, you know, feels totally fitting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And President Tokayev's gave this video address honoring the workers and veterans there. He called it the cradle of global astronautics, which, you know, feels totally fitting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President of Kazakhstan addressed workers and veterans of the space industry on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the cosmodrome " the world's oldest international spaceport, which became the cradle of global astronautics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, this is where it all started—Sputnik in 1957, then Gagarin in '61. Hard to overstate how huge that was.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, this is where it all started-Sputnik in nineteen fifty seven, then Gagarin in 'sixty one. Hard to overstate how huge that was.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was from here in 1957 that the first artificial satellite of Earth was launched, marking the beginning of the space exploration era. A few years later, in 1961, the first cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin embarked on his historic flight from Baikonur.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And he mentioned how it united people across the planet, inspired faith in science… like, that kind of optimism feels almost nostalgic now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And he mentioned how it united people across the planet, inspired faith in science... like, that kind of optimism feels almost nostalgic now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This epoch-making event united people across the planet and inspired faith in science and the progress of civilization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But it's still active, right? Thousands of satellites, dozens of crewed missions… and those Kazakh cosmonauts he named—Toktar Aubakirov, Talgat Musabayev…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's still active, right? Thousands of satellites, dozens of crewed missions... and those Kazakh cosmonauts he named-Toktar Aubakirov, Talgat Musabayev...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the years, thousands of satellites have been launched from Baikonur, and dozens of crewed missions have taken off. 'Our national heroes ' Toktar Aubakirov, Talgat Musabayev, and Aydin Aimbetov ' flew into space from here.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Aydin Aimbetov too. It's cool that he highlighted national pride in the spaceport being on Kazakh soil, even though it's leased to Russia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Aydin Aimbetov too. It's cool that he highlighted national pride in the spaceport being on Kazakh soil, even though it's leased to Russia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kassym-Jomart Tokayev emphasized that Kazakhstan takes particular pride in the fact that the world's largest spaceport is located on Kazakh soil. Since 1994, the city and cosmodrome have been leased by Russia from Kazakhstan, making it not only a key space facility but also a special zone within the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that lease arrangement is so unique—since 1994, right? A whole city and cosmodrome under that agreement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that lease arrangement is so unique-since nineteen ninety four, right? A whole city and cosmodrome under that agreement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since 1994, the city and cosmodrome have been leased by Russia from Kazakhstan, making it not only a key space facility but also a special zone within the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And he talked about turning Baikonur into an international hub—tourism, education, scientific exchange. Like, expanding beyond just launches.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he talked about turning Baikonur into an international hub-tourism, education, scientific exchange. Like, expanding beyond just launches.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan aims to turn Baikonur into a hub of international cooperation, scientific exchange, tourism, and educational attraction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense—space services are evolving so fast. Creating opportunities for young engineers and scientists… that's the future.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense-space services are evolving so fast. Creating opportunities for young engineers and scientists... that's the future.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There is great potential in entering new markets for space services and in creating opportunities for young engineers, designers, and scientists to realize their potential,' the message says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He also gave a special shoutout to the residents of Baikonur city itself. Their dedication to preserving that legacy… you gotta respect that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He also gave a special shoutout to the residents of Baikonur city itself. Their dedication to preserving that legacy... you gotta respect that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Head of State extended special words of gratitude to the residents of the city of Baikonur: 'Your dedicated work and careful attitude toward the legacy of space pioneers deserve the highest respect.'

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's not just a launch site—it's a community with a real sense of mission.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's not just a launch site-it's a community with a real sense of mission.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And you know, calling it a driver of innovation and progress… it's a reminder of what space exploration can still achieve.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And you know, calling it a driver of innovation and progress... it's a reminder of what space exploration can still achieve.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The space sector has always united humanity, serving as a driver of innovation and scientific-technical progress.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely feels like he's framing it as not just history, but the next chapter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely feels like he's framing it as not just history, but the next chapter.
